alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 08 at 3:34AM HST until January 09 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING THROUGH TONIGHT FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY STARTING THIS EVENING FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large northwest swell is spreading down the island chain. This swell will cause surf to build along exposed north and west facing shores of the smaller islands through this afternoon. Surf will likely reach the High Surf Warning criteria along all of these shorelines by this evening. Surf will also likely reach the High Surf Advisory criteria along exposed west facing shores of the Big Island tonight, with surf near the warning criteria there by Sunday morning. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM HST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet starting this evening. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM HST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
